content.body: does it have to be a data property? can it be a getter that throws instead? (I’m sure I’m missing some context here)
They must be fields for a number of reasons: Fixed layout, performance, use with Atomics, etc.
content.formatted_body: They must be fields for a number of reasons: Fixed layout, performance, use with Atomics, etc.

content.body: the descriptor could have a fake getter/setter even if the property is a data property under the hood, i suppose
what would these fake getter and setters even do when plucked and called explicitly ? Also that means the engine needs to allocate them
I'd much rather say that the own prop MOPs don't "work" and all have `undefined` value fields
content.formatted_body: I'd much rather say that the own prop MOPs don't "work" and all have undefined value fields
